name: My Supermarket
description:
My SuperMarket is a third-person simulation game in which you, as a member of a team of up to 4 people, own a supermarket in the middle of the city.
It is your responsibility to manage the supermarket, organize and serve the customers while expanding and making the most profit you can.

CUSTOMIZE YOUR SUPERMARKET


Buy new objects, place them where you want, rotate, align, you name it. Your supermarket, your rules.
Choose from a catalog of items ranging from the standard ones needed to sell products in your supermarket to slot machines, frames, plants, and more.

ORDER PRODUCTS


Order products and have them delivered to your store and placed on your shelves.
Manage your warehouse products and get them whenever you need them.

KEEP SHELVES FILLED


After delivery, your job is to restock the shelves with enough products to keep your customers happy. Remember, a happy customer is a returning customer.

SERVE YOUR CUSTOMERS


Keep an eye on your cash register and don't keep customers waiting too long, they won't be very happy if you do.

KEEP STORE CLEAN


Some customers throw trash on the floor, others have dirty shoes.
Try to keep your store as clean as possible because customers don't like dirty places.

DIFFERENT EVENTS


Deal with different types of events. From customers who steal or are in a hurry, to a bus that has several customers eager to get some products off the shelves and be served.

UNLOCK PRODUCTS


Get more reputation as you go. More reputation means more products to choose from.
Try to keep your reputation and more importantly your bank balance positive!

PLAY WITH FRIENDS


How would you manage your supermarket when it gets too big? Friends!
Invite your friends to the lobby and play with them. Don't forget to hit each other :)

WHAT TO EXPECT IN THE FUTURE

  • Ongoing support and updates;
  • Multi-language support with more coming soon;
  • Build your own supermarket with different areas, walls and floors.
  • Build areas such as restrooms, coffee/staff/health zones, and more;
  • Hire people to help you whenever you need them;
  • Research new objects;
  • Negotiate with brands;
  • Others based on community feedback!
